item.title: Should Abortion be illegal?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:44, topic:46458”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=64680.msg773272#msg773272 date=1168819860]

At that point I guess they could choose to end their life themselves, I don’t agree with that either, but no one should be able to choose to end some other innocent person’s life.

what about euthanasia, where someone has a terminal illness, they will die eventually but in the meantime they experiance a lot of pain, they would want the doctor to take them off the life-support machine. do you agree with ending a life of someone who will die anyway?

I don’t agree with it, and I don’t believe I would ever choose that for myself, but if it was the person’s choice then it is fine with me. I don’t believe doctors should be able to make the choice for them though.

do you agree with ending a life of someone who will die anyway?

You are going to die anyway, do you want to die now?
[/quote]
You missed yakman’s point. The person may be able to choose to die, but not without experiencing extreme pain (physical or mental) before hand.

Think of it this way. Before surgery you get knocked out, so you don’t even know what is happening. With abortion, a (young!) fetus is not conscious (brain not developed), therefore cannot “feel” the death in the first place. If you wait for it to choose for its life to end, it WILL “feel” the pain that it could have avoided in the first place.

And notice I said young fetus. A more mature fetus should not be aborted, but a young fetus does not have much of a brain yet, thus I think the current laws are fine.[/quote]

So at what age do you draw the line then? Is there a certain moment that it is too old to abort? It is ending a life either way you look at it.

item.title: Should Abortion be illegal?
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

moparisthebest:

@sdouble, I know that adoption is not the best thing that can happen to a child, but your girlfriend does agree that it is better to be adopted than to have never lived at all, right?

Most of the time, yes. But because of the adoption, she’s incredibly depressed. Some little thing may happen (ie: she got a speeding ticket) and she’ll get upset. Then she’ll think about how she could have prevented it by simply driving the speed limit. Then she’ll remember that when she was in high school and still living with her adoptive partents, she received enough speeding tickets to get her license suspended. Then she’ll remember how upset her parents were. Then she’ll think about other ways she has upset them. Following that, she’ll think about how her brother and sister (offspring of the adoptive parents) don’t do things like that. Then she’ll feel she does things like that because her birth mother is a piece of trash that abandoned her because she wanted to party and have sex with every man willing. Then she’ll think about how much she hates her. Three hours of crying later, she’ll actually talk to me about it and it’s always the same thing. She hates her birth mother and herself. Two hours after that, she’ll realize she overreacted and everything is back to normal except she’s still pissed. And anything will set her off. Like dropping a piece of silverware on the floor and the noise scares her (I have hardwood floors). As I said, adoption is great, but it’s the only solution. Too bad it isn’t as easy on the child as everyone would expect. She hates to think about how her life would have been if her mother decided to just keep her instead.

I’ll never feel any other way about abortion. I think it’s wrong, I think whoever has one is a murdered, reagardless of when they get the abortion. As mopar said, once an egg is fertilized, a life has begun. I am with him on that. And ending that life, whether someone feels it is a human yet or not, is murder. But the mother may not give the child up for adoption so it could lead a semi-normal life. Why make the child suffer for 18 years? This would be a form of torture. Think about how you would feel growing up with a mother that doesn’t care about you at all. One that actualy tells you that if the government allowed it, you would have been aborted. Knowing your mother wanted to kill you before you even had a chance to live. Your own mother wanted to end your life. Some of these women would change over time and accept the child. Some will not and the child will always be a hinderance to them. I would rather receive a bullet to the head than go through that for 18 years.

item.title: Should Abortion be illegal?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:23, topic:46458”][quote author=lothy link=topic=64680.msg763632#msg763632 date=1168640892]

abortion should be illegal, its like murdering a person yet that person hasnt even lived yet…

You can’t have death without life.

They are alive.

Technically, different groups don’t regard the foetus as “living” until a certain stage has been reached. Generally, I think people would consider a foetus to be “living” after the first trimester. Of course, as I said that view is up to each person.

Personally, I wouldn’t see something as living if it didn’t respond in any way (for example, babies start kicking in the womb eventually - responses wouldn’t have to be that significant, but if it did nothing at all, then it wouldn’t be functioning, thus not living). So abortion before a certain level of development has occurred is fine with me. As mentioned by Yakman, abortion as means for contraception is wrong no matter which stage of development the foetus is currently at.

Oh, and someone tell me how to spell foetus if I’ve spelt it wrong.
[/quote]

The instant the semen enters the egg cells start dividing, reproduction is one of the key signs of life, not to mention that cells are accepted by all to be living, therefore the fetus is alive from the very beginning.

@sdouble, I know that adoption is not the best thing that can happen to a child, but your girlfriend does agree that it is better to be adopted than to have never lived at all, right?[/quote]
The group of cells are definately considered living, but they aren’t considered a human by many until they reach a certain stage - of course, this statement isn’t true for everyone; many like yourself would instantly say it’s a living human, which is fair and needs to be respected.

However, some would say that once fingers and other limbs are visible, it’s human. Others say once it can respond it’s human. Others might just say after the first or second trimester.
Basically, it’s up to each different person.
